get.summary: Endpoint used by Sled Agents to download cached artifacts.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: The kind of update artifact this is.

get.description: This is a list of discrete background activities that Nexus carries out. This is exposed for support and debugging.

get.summary: Fetch status of one background task
get.description: This is exposed for support and debugging.

post.summary: Request removal of a read_only_parent from a disk
post.description: This is a thin wrapper around the volume_remove_read_only_parent saga. All we are doing here is, given a disk UUID, figure out what the volume_id is for that disk, then use that to call the volume_remove_read_only_parent saga on it.

put.summary: Report updated state for a disk.
Report updated state for an instance.

get.summary: Endpoint for oximeter to collect nexus server metrics.

post.summary: Accept a notification of a new oximeter collection server.
Accept a registration from a new metric producer

get.description: Caller provides their generation as `from_gen`, along with a query parameter for the page size (`limit`). Endpoint will return changes that have occured since the caller's generation number up to the latest change or until the `limit` is reached. If there are no changes, an empty vec is returned.

parameters.name: from_gen
parameters.description: which change number to start generating the change set from

put.summary: Report that a physical disk for the specified sled has come online.

delete.summary: Report that a physical disk for the specified sled has gone offline.

put.summary: Report that the Rack Setup Service initialization is complete

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retrieve the subsequent page

post.summary: Report that the sled agent for the specified sled has come online.

put.summary: Report that a pool for a specified sled has come online.

post.summary: Request removal of a read_only_parent from a volume
post.description: A volume can be created with the source data for that volume being another volume that attached as a "read_only_parent". In the background there exists a scrubber that will copy the data from the read_only_parent into the volume. When that scrubber has completed copying the data, this endpoint can be called to update the database that the read_only_parent is no longer needed for a volume and future attachments of this volume should not include that read_only_parent.

ActivationReason.description:
Describes why a background task was activated

This is only used for debugging.  This is deliberately not made available to the background task itself.  See "Design notes" in the module-level documentation for details.

BackgroundTask.description:
Background tasks

These are currently only intended for observability by developers.  We will eventually want to flesh this out into something more observable for end users.

description.description: brief summary (for developers) of what this task does

name.description: unique identifier for this background task

period.description:
how long after an activation completes before another will be triggered automatically

(activations can also be triggered for other reasons)

Baseboard.description: Describes properties that should uniquely identify Oxide manufactured hardware

asn.description: The autonomous system number for the BGP configuration.

originate.description: The set of prefixes for the BGP router to originate.

asn.description: The autonomous sysetm number of the router the peer belongs to.

connect_retry.description: The interval in seconds between peer connection retry attempts.

delay_open.description: How long to delay sending open messages to a peer. In seconds.

hold_time.description: How long to keep a session alive without a keepalive in seconds. Defaults to 6.

idle_hold_time.description: How long to keep a peer in idle after a state machine reset in seconds.

keepalive.description: The interval to send keepalive messages at.

port.description: Switch port the peer is reachable on.

BinRangedouble.description:
A type storing a range over `T`.

This type supports ranges similar to the `RangeTo`, `Range` and `RangeFrom` types in the standard library. Those cover `(..end)`, `(start..end)`, and `(start..)` respectively.

oneOf.description: A range unbounded below and exclusively above, `..end`.
A range bounded inclusively below and exclusively above, `start..end`.
A range bounded inclusively below and unbounded above, `start..`.

A type storing a range over `T`.

This type supports ranges similar to the `RangeTo`, `Range` and `RangeFrom` types in the standard library. Those cover `(..end)`, `(start..end)`, and `(start..)` respectively.

A range bounded inclusively below and unbounded above, `start..`.

Bindouble.description: Type storing bin edges and a count of samples within it.

count.description: The total count of samples in this bin.

range.description: The range of the support covered by this bin.

Binfloat.description: Type storing bin edges and a count of samples within it.

count.description: The total count of samples in this bin.

range.description: The range of the support covered by this bin.

count.description: The total count of samples in this bin.

ByteCount.description: Byte count to express memory or storage capacity.

Cumulativedouble.description: A cumulative or counter data type.

Cumulativefloat.description: A cumulative or counter data type.

Cumulativeint64.description: A cumulative or counter data type.

Cumulativeuint64.description: A cumulative or counter data type.

CurrentStatus.description: Describes the current status of a background task

oneOf.description:
The background task is not running

Typically, the task would be waiting for its next activation, which would happen after a timeout or some other event that triggers activation

The background task is currently running

More precisely, the task has been activated and has not yet finished this activation

reason.description: what kind of event triggered this activation

start_time.description: wall-clock time when the current activation started

DatasetKind.description: Describes the purpose of the dataset.

DatasetPutRequest.description: Describes a dataset within a pool.

address.description: Address on which a service is responding to requests for the dataset.

Datum.description: A `Datum` is a single sampled data point from a metric.

DiskRuntimeState.description: Runtime state of the Disk, which includes its attach state and some minimal metadata

oneOf.description: Disk is being initialized
Disk is ready but detached from any Instance
Disk is ready to receive blocks from an external source
Disk is importing blocks from a URL
Disk is importing blocks from bulk writes
Disk is being finalized to state Detached
Disk is undergoing maintenance
Disk is being attached to the given Instance
Disk is attached to the given Instance
Disk is being detached from the given Instance
Disk has been destroyed
Disk is unavailable

Field.description: A `Field` is a named aspect of a target or metric.

FieldValue.description: The `FieldValue` contains the value of a target or metric field.

Generation.description: Generation numbers stored in the database, used for optimistic concurrency control

HistogramError.description: Errors related to constructing histograms or adding samples into them.

oneOf.description: An attempt to construct a histogram with an empty set of bins.
An attempt to construct a histogram with non-monotonic bins.
A non-finite was encountered, either as a bin edge or a sample.
Error returned when two neighboring bins are not adjoining (there's space between them)
Bin and count arrays are of different sizes.

Histogramdouble.description:
Histogram metric

A histogram maintains the count of any number of samples, over a set of bins. Bins are specified on construction via their _left_ edges, inclusive. There can't be any "gaps" in the bins, and an additional bin may be added to the left, right, or both so that the bins extend to the entire range of the support.

Note that any gaps, unsorted bins, or non-finite values will result in an error.

InstanceRuntimeState.description: The dynamic runtime properties of an instance: its current VMM ID (if any), migration information (if any), and the instance state to report if there is no active VMM.

dst_propolis_id.description: If a migration is active, the ID of the target VMM.

migration_id.description: If a migration is active, the ID of that migration.

propolis_id.description: The instance's currently active VMM ID.

InstanceState.description:
Running state of an Instance (primarily: booted or stopped)

This typically reflects whether it's starting, running, stopping, or stopped, but also includes states related to the Instance's lifecycle

oneOf.description: The instance is being created.
The instance is currently starting up.
The instance is currently running.
The instance has been requested to stop and a transition to "Stopped" is imminent.
The instance is currently stopped.
The instance is in the process of rebooting - it will remain in the "rebooting" state until the VM is starting once more.
The instance is in the process of migrating - it will remain in the "migrating" state until the migration process is complete and the destination propolis is ready to continue execution.
The instance is attempting to recover from a failure.
The instance has encountered a failure.
The instance has been deleted.

Ipv4Range.description:
A non-decreasing IPv4 address range, inclusive of both ends.

The first address must be less than or equal to the last address.

Ipv6Range.description:
A non-decreasing IPv6 address range, inclusive of both ends.

The first address must be less than or equal to the last address.

oneOf.description: The task has never completed an activation
The task has completed at least one activation

details.description: arbitrary datum emitted by the background task

elapsed.description: total time elapsed during the activation

reason.description: what kind of event triggered this activation

start_time.description: wall-clock time when the activation started

MacAddr.title: A MAC address
MacAddr.description: A Media Access Control address, in EUI-48 format

Measurement.description: A `Measurement` is a timestamped datum from a single metric

MetricsError.description: Errors related to the generation or collection of metrics.

oneOf.description: An error related to generating metric data points
An error running an `Oximeter` server
An error related to creating or sampling a [`histogram::Histogram`] metric.
An error parsing a field or measurement from a string.
A field name is duplicated between the target and metric.

Name.title: A name unique within the parent collection
Name.description: Names must begin with a lower case ASCII letter, be composed exclusively of lowercase ASCII, uppercase ASCII, numbers, and '-', and may not end with a '-'. Names cannot be a UUID though they may contain a UUID.

NewPasswordHash.title: A password hash in PHC string format
NewPasswordHash.description: Password hashes must be in PHC (Password Hashing Competition) string format.  Passwords must be hashed with Argon2id.  Password hashes may be rejected if the parameters appear not to be secure enough.

NodeName.description:
Unique name for a saga [`Node`]

Each node requires a string name that's unique within its DAG.  The name is used to identify its output.  Nodes that depend on a given node (either directly or indirectly) can access the node's output using its name.

OximeterInfo.description: Message used to notify Nexus that this oximeter instance is up and running.

address.description: The address on which this oximeter instance listens for requests

collector_id.description: The ID for this oximeter instance.

PhysicalDiskKind.description: Describes the form factor of physical disks.

port.description: Nmae of the port this config applies to.

routes.description: The set of routes associated with this port.

ProducerEndpoint.description: Information announced by a metric server, used so that clients can contact it and collect available metric data from it.

address.description: The IP address and port at which `oximeter` can collect metrics from the producer.

base_route.description:
The API base route from which `oximeter` can collect metrics.

The full route is `{base_route}/{id}`.

id.description: A unique ID for this producer.

interval.description: The interval on which `oximeter` should collect metrics.

ProducerKind.description: The kind of metric producer this is.

oneOf.description: The producer is a sled-agent.
The producer is an Omicron-managed service.
The producer is a Propolis VMM managing a guest instance.

QuantizationError.description: Errors occurring during quantizated bin generation.

certs.description: x.509 Certificates used to encrypt communication with the external API.

datasets.description: Datasets on the rack which have been provisioned by RSS.

external_dns_zone_name.description: delegated DNS name for external DNS

external_port_count.description: The external qsfp ports per sidecar

internal_services_ip_pool_ranges.description: Ranges of the service IP pool which may be used for internal services, such as Nexus.

services.description: Services on the rack which have been created by RSS.

bgp.description: BGP configurations for connecting the rack to external networks

infra_ip_first.description: First ip address to be used for configuring network infrastructure

infra_ip_last.description: Last ip address to be used for configuring network infrastructure

ports.description: Uplinks for connecting the rack to external networks

Saga.description:
Sagas

These are currently only intended for observability by developers.  We will eventually want to flesh this out into something more observable for end users.

items.description: list of items on this page of results

next_page.description: token used to fetch the next page of results (if any)

oneOf.description: Saga is currently executing
Saga completed successfully
One or more saga actions failed and the saga was successfully unwound (i.e., undo actions were executed for any actions that were completed). The saga is no longer running.

One or more saga actions failed, *and* one or more undo actions failed during unwinding.  State managed by the saga may now be inconsistent. Support may be required to repair the state.  The saga is no longer running.

Sample.description: A concrete type representing a single, timestamped measurement from a timeseries.

measurement.description: The measured value of the metric at this sample

timeseries_name.description: The name of the timeseries this sample belongs to

ServiceKind.description: Describes the purpose of the service.

ServiceNic.description: Describes the RSS allocated values for a service vnic

ServicePutRequest.description: Describes a service on a sled

address.description: Address on which a service is responding to requests.

SledAgentStartupInfo.description: Sent by a sled agent on startup to Nexus to request further instruction

reservoir_size.description:
Amount of RAM dedicated to the VMM reservoir

Must be smaller than "usable_physical_ram"

role.description: Describes the responsibilities of the sled

sa_address.description: The address of the sled agent's API endpoint

usable_hardware_threads.description: The number of hardware threads which can execute on this sled

usable_physical_ram.description: Amount of RAM which may be used by the Sled's OS

SledInstanceState.description: A wrapper type containing a sled's total knowledge of the state of a specific VMM and the instance it incarnates.

instance_state.description: The sled's conception of the state of the instance.

propolis_id.description: The ID of the VMM whose state is being reported.

vmm_state.description: The most recent state of the sled's VMM process.

SledRole.description:
Describes the role of the sled within the rack.

Note that this may change if the sled is physically moved within the rack.

oneOf.description: The sled is a general compute sled.
The sled is attached to the network switch, and has additional responsibilities.

SourceNatConfig.description: An IP address and port range used for source NAT, i.e., making outbound network connections from guests or services.

first_port.description: The first port used for source NAT, inclusive.

ip.description: The external address provided to the instance or service.

last_port.description: The last port used for source NAT, also inclusive.

oneOf.description: Switch in upper slot
Switch in lower slot

UserId.title: A name unique within the parent collection
UserId.description: Names must begin with a lower case ASCII letter, be composed exclusively of lowercase ASCII, uppercase ASCII, numbers, and '-', and may not end with a '-'. Names cannot be a UUID though they may contain a UUID.

VmmRuntimeState.description: The dynamic runtime properties of an individual VMM process.

gen.description: The generation number for this VMM's state.

state.description: The last state reported by this VMM.

ZpoolPutRequest.description: Sent by a sled agent on startup to Nexus to request further instruction

KnownArtifactKind.description: Kinds of update artifacts, as used by Nexus to determine what updates are available and by sled-agent to determine how to apply an update when asked.

IdSortMode.description:
Supported set of sort modes for scanning by id only.

Currently, we only support scanning in ascending order.

oneOf.description: sort in increasing order of "id"
